com.chessgear.data

Class DatabaseServiceTestTool

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.chessgear.data.DatabaseServiceTestTool

  • public class DatabaseServiceTestTool
extends java.lang.Object
    Since the class is only used for testing purposes, we call faill at any exception thrown. Ideas for reflexivity were found there: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5629706/java-accessing-private-constructor-with-type-parameters http://onjavahell.blogspot.com/2009/05/testing-private-methods-using.html We also had to use reflexivity in order to change static fields in various class referencing to the singletons. It gives a pretty hacky coding in the end but it's the only way to do it without having to recompile the project for each tests. Created by GradyXiao on 12/7/15.

    • Method Detail

      • createFileStorageService

        public static FileStorageService createFileStorageService()
        Creates a new FileStorageService in a fresh folder by mean of reflexivity. Don't forget to destroy it after use.
        Returns:
        A fresh FileStorageService for tests.

      • destroyFileStorageService

        public static void destroyFileStorageService(FileStorageService fss)
        Cleans the workspace of the specified FileStorageService. Also takes care of the referenced DatabaseService
        Parameters:
        fss - The FileStorageService to delete.

      • createDatabase

        public static DatabaseService createDatabase(boolean fillWithValues)
        Creates a fresh DatabaseService for testing puprose, by mean of reflexivity. Don't forget to destroy it after use.
        Parameters:
        fillWithValues - specify if the Database has to have some initial mockup value or no.
        Returns:
        database The actual DatabaseService

      • destroyDatabase

        public static void destroyDatabase(DatabaseService db)
                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Destroys the database passed in
        Parameters:
        db - the database that has to be deleted
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • changeGetInstanceOfInDatabaseService

        public static void changeGetInstanceOfInDatabaseService(DatabaseService replaceWith,
                                                        DatabaseWrapper inst)
        Takes care of replacing static refs in appropriate classes. The DatabaseWrapper instance is here to take of the particular instance ref since the field is not static. If no DatabaseWrapper is used during the test, then DatabaseWrapper.getInstance() should be passed in. After having call this method and run the code, one should call putGetInstanceOfBackToNormal().
        Parameters:
        replaceWith - The new database, for instance from a call to createDatabase().
        inst - The DatabaseWrapper used in.

      • changeGetInstanceOfInFileStorageServiceClass

        public static void changeGetInstanceOfInFileStorageServiceClass(FileStorageService replaceWith)
        Changes the static reference in FileStorageService to allow call to getInstanceOf(). Also takes care of the static ref in the User class. After having call this method and run the code, one should call putGetInstanceOfBackToNormal().
        Parameters:
        replaceWith - The new FileStorageService. For instance via constructFileStorageService().

      • putGetInstanceOfBackToNormal

        public static void putGetInstanceOfBackToNormal(DatabaseWrapper inst)
        Put All references back to normal in all known classes storing reference to DatabaseService and FileStorageService
        Parameters:
        inst - The DatabaseWrapper instance that the tests uses. We have controll it since it has a databaseservice field in it. If no DatabaseWrapper is used in the test, just pass DatabaseWrapper.getInstance() default value.
